wikipedia_page.main: Sir William Hustler (c. 1658–1730), of Acklam, Yorkshire, and Little Hatfield, Holderness, Yorkshire was an English draper and Whig politician who sat in the English and British House of Commons between 1695 and 1710. He was a member of the Society for Promoting Christian Knowledge and was great patron of charity schools.

response: Scampston Hall was built in the late 1600s for William Hustler.
